website_summaries.verdict: The Diva Cup is a high-quality option with a variety of benefits.
pros: This cup stands out for its comfort and ease of use
Women who have used this option love that it can be worn overnight, and most give it top marks for its ability to prevent leaks
cons: A few women note that the instructions could be improved, and some feel there is a learning curve to using it properly

customer_reviews.title: and the instructions looked like they were photocopied
customer_reviews.text: I received a counterfeit product. The silicone was thinner and the cup weighed less than my old one, the box was a different color, the bag was a different color and smaller, and the instructions looked like they were photocopied.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Warnock

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, this model is for 18 and under. I'm actually 26, it just depends on your body types don't go by age.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe anyone actually uses these things. They don't work at all and now I'm out $30 because I believed all the hype and lies. I think most anything would work better than a menstrual cup. There are very good reasons most women still use tampons- it's because it takes about 30 seconds to learn how to use tampons and these menstrual cups DON'T WORK. To anyone considering trying these- have fun cleaning up your bathroom when it looks like a crime scene after using one of these!
customer_reviews.author: Farfanugen

customer_reviews.title: FAKE ONE !!!! DO NOT BUY IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I get this product on this website and download the verification app to be sure about the authenticity of the product and guess what ??? The code wasn’t recognized by the app, not the shiny label and not the 10 characters I introduced manually. So It’s Fake!!! DON’T BUY IT !!!
customer_reviews.author: Susana Calderon

customer_reviews.title: For me, this one is better than the Mooncup.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because after cutting off the irritating stem, the Mooncup was a **NIGHTMARE** to get out. The Diva Cup is longer so even after getting rid of the stem, it was still easy to remove. I guess my.. umm, my insides.. whatever.. is too long for the Mooncup, so it was hard to get a grip on it in order to pull it out, especially since it's a little slippery down there.. other than that, I think there is no notable differene between the Diva Cup and the Mooncup. I'm sorry for not comparing it with the Mooncup in the photos. I threw it out in a feat of rage haha
customer_reviews.author: Ella

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted this to work
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this would be a product I could use to replace tampons. However, I found it not only difficult to use but also painful, not in placing it but in removing it. I found it cumbersome and troublesome to insert. After numerous attempts on several occassions I gave up. But, not before I'd received what felt like scrapes from trying to turn 180 degrees and then upon removal. Lest you think I ordered the wrong size, I have had two children so that was not the issue. Glad others had success, but for me I'm just out $30.
customer_reviews.author: CindyV

customer_reviews.title: It still works if you're 18 or older
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the size 1 was difficult to make it pop after it was in and some time it hurts but with size 0 was a lot easier but it's small so I do need to change it more often
customer_reviews.author: Maca

customer_reviews.title: Warning not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: About this after a girlfriend of mine raved about it. In fact two girlfriends of mine raved about it. I tried putting it in. I know I did it right I’m a nurse and I know my anatomy. I found it to be extremely painful and uncomfortable and it actually triggered pelvic floor spasms. Granted I have a retroverted uterus with a cyst on it possibly endometriosis and occasional pelvic floor spasms. If you have any of these things I do not recommend this product for you
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Very rigid, large and inflexible
customer_reviews.text: Yikes. I ordered model 0 (27yrs) and I had the hardest time putting it in. The silicone is extremely thick and large. I really, REALLY wanted to like this and use something better for the environment but too painful to insert. I also tried The different insertion techniques with no luck :(
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Sizes aren't accurate
customer_reviews.text: I bought the size 2 since I'm 34 and have had 3 kids....turns out I may actually need the size 1. I can not get the cup to go inside. Folded it just like the instructions said (tried both ways) and it will not go past a certain point. There just isn't any room. So I'm super bummed that I spent the money on it only to have to find out that I'll have to spend more money to see if the other size will fit. And if that doesn't fit....oh well. Back to tampons it will be I guess. The period panties are just too expensive for a full set.
customer_reviews.author: April Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best Invention for Periods
customer_reviews.text: I recommend these to every woman I know. They're easy to insert, remove, and clean. They're comfortable and practical. Imagine never having to buy tampons again! It saves money and relieves anxiety about toxic shock syndrome. On my heavy days, I use it with my Thinx absorbent panties...but I occasionally have a VERY heavy flow, so I doubt most other women would have to do this. The size recommendations are accurate. I thought the Model 2 was a little big for me, so I got a Model 1--don't get me wrong, there is zero discomfort with Model 2, it was just a little more difficult to insert. The Model 1 leaks more often, so go by the recommended sizes!
customer_reviews.author: missmopar05

customer_reviews.title: Slips out slowly
customer_reviews.text: Slips out slowly throughout the day. I bought my first one (same brand/size) at a store and absolutely love it, however the one I bought on Amazon isn’t quite the same. It doesn’t stay in place throughout the day and I’m afraid it will come out completely. Buy in a reputable store, online is possibly a knock off.
customer_reviews.author: Different

customer_reviews.title: I wish they had invented this sooner
customer_reviews.text: I resisted trying one of these for a long time despite some of my friends having made the switch years ago. I finally did it. Omg. Once you get the hang of putting it in (there is definitely a learning curve of a day or two.) you will be hooked! Never buy tampons again, don’t worry about leaks or strings, go all day without worry. Absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: shannon crow

customer_reviews.title: big nope - I'm not buying products like this online anymore
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting to try the cup method for some time now and I was really disappointed when I received my Diva Cup. The box was slightly damaged, probably because it wasn't packaged well at all. But the worst part was when I opened the box and the cup was covered in dust/grime. I know it can (and should!) be cleaned, but since this product is meant to go INSIDE my body... I wasn't taking any chances. We're talking $30 for a piece of silicone, is it too much to ask that it be clean?
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Still buying pads...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy this and throw my pads in the trash and never look back. I purchased this about a year ago. I wanted to give it time before I gave it a review to be fair. Getting it in and out can be tricky and very messy. If it's not PERFECTLY in it will leak. So you end up wearing both a pad and this thing. By the time you figure out the perfect angle boom aunt flow is gone and you're starting all over with the same headache. Also I noticed after being in for a bit the pressure from certain angles caused my cramps to intensify so I tossed it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happier with other brands!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 4 menstrual cups and loved them all until this one. It simply will not get in the right position or find a comfortable resting place so I'm painfully aware of its presence all day while it is completely ineffective at its job. Will not purchase again and will be using a different brand going forward. I'm really disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Emily L Shea

customer_reviews.title: She Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: Several years ago my wife said that she would be interested in trying the Diva Cup. We don't have any kids and we aren't going to so as a tongue-in-cheek joke, I got her the model 1 Diva Cup for Mother's Day. She was excited! She said there was a little learning curve in order to remove it, but once you get the hang of it, it's no problem. She likes that she doesn't have to mess with (or spend money on) tampons and pads.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Miovech

customer_reviews.title: Socially responsible periods!
customer_reviews.text: I was a skeptic, but a few of my friends went on and on about this thing, so I bought it. It's awesome. A little gross, perhaps, but I only need to clean it out twice a day (even on heavy days) and I'm not disposing of a wrapper, a cardboard or plastic tube, and a tampon. Only complaint? To be frank: it's fairly difficult to move your bowels with it in because of where it sits in the vagina. There. I said it. Eeeew. But it is what it is, and otherwise, it's great!
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I’ve been waiting for!
customer_reviews.text: I try to be as environmentally friendly as possible and have always loathed sanitary napkins and tampons because of the plastic content. This is the answer I’ve been looking for! I bought the Model 2 despite being 23 just because I am 230 lbs and feel I need the extra security of having a larger cup. Thankfully, I had no problem with insertion and removal whatsoever. It does take some getting used to, but once you get the hang of it you’ll forget it’s even there.
customer_reviews.author: Voodoo Coffee

customer_reviews.title: life changing!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used to CRINGE to the thought of using a diva cup...until I bought one. LIFE. CHANGING. I have a very heavy flow. I used to leak with all products, tampons, pads, etc. Using the cup allows me to set it and forget it for up to 7 hours! NO LEAKS! NO PERIOD SMELL! You have to be comfortable with touching yourself down there, but once you get the hang of it, you will love it! NEVER GOING BACK TO TAMPONS OR PADS AGAIN!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Holly Adams

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been my whole life
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. I read so many reviews and was hesitant about trying this as some of the reviews were a little scarry. Now that I've tried it I am not sure how I can live without it! I read the instructions cover to cover, did everything as suggested and its the best thing ever! Had no problems putting it in or taking it out. I've always had heavy flows so for me it lasts 6 hours before it fills up and leaks instead of 12 but its still worth it! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: LilNafania

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, tricky learning curve.
customer_reviews.text: So I do love the DivaCup, but I'm still learning. For more context I am under 18 and have never had sex, so the tightness down there makes it a bit more tricky to be popping the cup in and out. First time I tried this I kept PINCHING myself. (Gotta clip those nails until you get the hanG of it!). The next month it was a little easier, but I was still having trouble with unfolding the fold so the suction would work (if that makes sense), so if I can't get the hang of it, I'll definitely try again in a couple years. I would 100% give this a shot. It lives up to the hype!!!
customer_reviews.author: Melia Kapri

customer_reviews.title: DivaCup is great, check for counterfeit
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a diva cup for years and really love it. I just bought one from CVS ($25 with weekly 40% coupon) as I just realized the one I have is counterfeit. Here’s what I noticed with the new box: 1. When looking at the front of the box flip it to the right, there should be a hologram sticker there with the QR code. 2. The DivaCup text and pink icon on the front of the box should be raised. I received a counterfeit one from amazon but I can’t tell if it was from this listing. The box had spelling errors so it was easy to spot.
customer_reviews.author: AriBoBari

customer_reviews.title: Good bye Tampons , Hello Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: The purchase of this product was easy and the deliver was very fast. You should read carefully and try over the weekend, to be sure you understand how to use it. By the 2 day of the cycle it was easier to use and at this point possible the best product I've purchased for my cycles. Make sure if you are rising it do it under hot water, and use the wipes for cleaning. It will last all day. Best product ever!
customer_reviews.author: Mom Prime

customer_reviews.title: Too firm!
customer_reviews.text: The Diva Cup just didn't work for me. The top 1/4 inch or so at the rim is very firm, making it uncomfortable to wear. And it didn't seem to allow it to conform to my body, cause it also leaked. Then I tried the Luna cup after reading it was softer than the Diva. I'm in love. So easy to insert, definitely softer, and I can't feel it at all. People said I might have trouble getting it to open cause it's softer, but I haven't had any difficulty at all. It seems to conform to my body much better due to being softer, cause I haven't had a single leak.
customer_reviews.author: niki

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Wish I had known about it 25 years ago, if it even existed.
customer_reviews.text: Where have you been all of my life?? Seriously, I absolutely love this thing! The only down side is that you have to get a lot more comfortable with "handling yourself" since it entails more than just pulling out a string or inserting a feminine product. If you can get past that, then I highly recommend it. No more strings, leaks (as long as it's inserted correctly) or changing feminine products as often. Did they have these 25 years ago when I first started getting my period? If so, I could have made a lot of money as a salesperson for this product, because it is absolutely fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Anne H.

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: The theory is good, but the cup has a little “grip” at the bottom that can be cut down - which I did (almost all the way). The cup is fine when I first insert it, but that “grip” piece scrapes my insides as the cup tilted forward during the day. Extremely painful. Didn’t have a problem getting it in or out, just cannot handle that extended tab at the bottom. Wish it had worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: HLS

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if it is new, not taking any chances!! GROSS!
customer_reviews.text: Do you ship out previously returned items!?! This was supposed to be a gift for my teen but the box looks scrapped up and you can see the cup through the window and there are black spots on it!?! This does not look like a NEW!! GROSS!!! I can't imagine shipping returned products but I would not think this is new by any means. This is not acceptable, and it can't be returned?!?! That policy would be okay for a brand new clean product, but not for a filthy gross product. You do realize these go inside your body!! What a waste of money, this is not okay!
customer_reviews.author: Charla

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: This is a total game changer. I have saved so much money in the long run by switching to the Diva Cup. I have two qualms with the product though: 1) The price. This should not cost anywhere close to $30. 2) The lingering odor. After a few months of use, you will never ever be able to get the horrible odor out of this cup. For transparency, I have a relatively odorless reproductive organ in general, and I wash this product with soap after each 12hr period. At the end of each cycle, I also boil this product to ensure cleanliness. The rancid stench will not go away.
customer_reviews.author: Ky

customer_reviews.title: Turn it inside out if you can’t seem to love it! Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad I read on here in reviews that you can turn it inside out! Game changer! I was about to quit because it kept slipping down and wasn’t comfortable with the tail rubbing you know where. If you have a similar discomfort issues where you want to love it but it doesn’t feel right, turn it inside out or at least cut off the tail! Sooo much better!!! I do still have some leaks, which is why I didn’t give it 5 stars, but certainly less wasteful to use a liner and this cup than tampons and/or pads all the time. Give this a shot! Cleaner for you and the environment, plus saving money each month!
customer_reviews.author: B. Cheek

customer_reviews.title: If you menstruate, you need it. Period.
customer_reviews.text: I head about the Diva Cup when I was about 20, and it took me 8 long years to finally try it. And I kinda hate myself for it. I could have been having a way better period experience for basically my whole 20's. So learn from my mistake. If you are even thinking about trying it, think no more and just buy it. There's a little learning curve, but there is a whole community of people to help you get it right. I have saved money on disposable sanitary products. I've saved my panties from dreaded stains. I have come to appreciate my body in a new way. The Diva Cup is a gift to the bleeding world.
customer_reviews.author: K. Herawood

customer_reviews.title: Owwwwwwwwwwww!
customer_reviews.text: These things are not for everyone. They are not for me. I've tried the sizes, cut the stem, and just...just, no. I use the Instead Softcup although I think they were acquired recently and changed their brand name. (Instead Softcup, Softcup, Flex cup). You can still get 'em and they have a reusable version now (Ziggy cup). Just putting that info here in case anyone's looking for waste reduction alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Gurl1der

customer_reviews.title: What even is this?!
customer_reviews.text: Excuse me? What in the false advertisement is this?! I did NOT order the knock off brand of the Diva Cup! As someone replacing the ORIGINAL Diva Cup (perviously bought buy this seller) you can tell there are differences between the two cups. The original user guide is a very nice wallet sized booket, this one is a crappy trifold piece of paper that puts a comma instead of a period in the costumer support email address..... don't get fooled by thinking your getting the Diva Cup at a cheaper price like I did...
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Essential Alternative!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product!! You can literally leave it in for hours, I usually change it 2-3 times in 24 hours (maybe the morning/before bed and one time in between if I feel it's necessary). The instruction manual is very helpful for a first time user and I will actually give a personal tip for those who are maybe struggling: removing the cup is VERY easy, but what the manual doesn't tell you is that it is much easier to pull out if you 'push' and also pull the stem of the diva cup. As you would expect proper hygiene is extremely important also in order to keep it lasting
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mixed results
customer_reviews.text: I am a 41 year old woman who has had 2 children. The model 2 cup is still a little wide for me and sometimes doesn’t want to open up fully one it’s inside my body. Other times, I have literally felt it pop open, which is a little strange! Other menstrual cups I’ve had have not done this. On the other hand, when it is open it is nice for heavy flow days. The bottom handle is hollow, which may make it stretchier and easier to grab but that also means that it catches stuff. That’s a bit gross, in my opinion. Overall, I am just not as pleased with this brand or model.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2BoysWF

customer_reviews.title: Make the switch!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using the diva up for 3 years now. I bought this one for my teenage cousin and she absolutely loves it! There is a learning curve when it comes to using this. I have saved SO MUCH MONEY, I also have reusable cloth pads. I have not spent a dime on menstrual products for 3 years. I (and my cousin) have very heavy periods. The cup is comfortable, change it in the morning and at night, no worrying about TSS and if it gets full you will know, it’s not a big deal to change in public. I have switched 6 women now and they are all grateful!!
customer_reviews.author: Iloveolives

customer_reviews.title: Not the brand for me.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second menstrual cup. The first one was great and from a different brand, so I purchased a diva cup to see if there was a lot of difference between brands. Yes. There is a lot of difference between brands. The ring on the Diva cup is stiff, making insertion more difficult and extraction sometimes painful. I don't normally cramp much during my cycle, but I've been suffering pretty badly this time around and there's no question that the cup is at fault. The Diva cup holds a smaller volume than the other cup I tried and is very prone both to leaking and slipping.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost went to er and cannot get a refund
customer_reviews.text: It got stuck!!! My boyfriend tried to help me get it out. Neither of us could get this out of me. I tried for over an hour was about to go to the er. Then I finally got it out. I'm also disappointed on the refund policy. I almost went to the er and wasted my money and time. I was late for my plans because I spent most of morning trying to get this device out. It says size two for C-section but I think I needed a one.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: life-changing
customer_reviews.text: So this product is much bigger than I imagined, so there went any worry about spilling or leakage. I bought this because someone told me it was life-changing. Once you get used to getting it in there, you can literally leave it in for 12 hours, as recommended. The selling point was that we don't bleed nearly as much as we think we do. No spills, no leaks, no constant worries like with tampons or pads. You can sleep in it, swim in it, scuba dive in it. I don't know what in the world Amazon means by "suction power" in the review... To date, it hasn't sucked any vital organs out, for which I am grateful.
customer_reviews.author: Harissa

customer_reviews.title: Do you like to play search and rescue?
customer_reviews.text: If you like light heart attacks and other people having to help you get bloody filled cups out of your vag - go for it! This cup caused small nightmares for me on a few occasions, enough to toss it and go to Lilly cup. I am in my early 40’s and have had one kiddo. I will say my teen daughter loooooves this cup. It just didn’t work for me. It takes a little work to find the perfect one for all bodies and I get that but this one is a hard no in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly

customer_reviews.title: First time.
customer_reviews.text: I have been told by many that the cups are easy to use and work well. Failed the first few times, but once I got the hang of it, it worked like a charm. Leave it and forget it (for at least 8-12 hours). I won't say that it is 100% comfortable. Some times it was better than other. Overall, I am satisfied with the product, and will continue to use. Please READ the instructions. The placement angle is important. Recommend watching a couple of YouTube videos on the subject. There were some helpful tips.
customer_reviews.author: m. savoie

customer_reviews.title: I have a pretty heavy period and it did not work at all
customer_reviews.text: I have a pretty heavy period and it did not work at all. It leaked, I made sure to read the directions and I tried the two different ways it tells you to use it (plus, making sure it created a "vacuum.") I'm going to try one more time, closer to when my period is coming to an end, but I would NOT recommend this to anyone who has severe bleeding. When first trying this product I would wear a pad with it (also do it on a day when you're home.) I think the reason why this works for other people is because their periods are light. Overall... disappointed that the product didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Genius!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Diva Cup! I bought it to simplify managing products while traveling abroad and planned to continue using it because it's supposed to be healthier than the pads I'd been using. What I didn't expect was the decrease in the length of my periods from 7 days to 5 days! I also had reduced cramping which was awesome as I used to have pretty severe cramps sometimes. I still had mild cramps, but nothing compared to what I used to have. Whoever thought up the menstrual cup in the first place was a genius.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Scot

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and no leakage
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the reviews, I was a little hesitant on sizing but decided to start out with size 1. I am over 30 and have had kids but I was scared it would be uncomfortable. I only used it on my last couple of days because so wasn’t sure if it would overflow. But I can say it was easy to put in and take out. And most important (I know most women complain or are hesitant about) I didn’t feel like I had to touch myself too much or “dig” to insert. I did not feel it at all wearing it all day. I am going to try the next size up now.
customer_reviews.author: Garner7580

customer_reviews.title: I like that it's reusable and recyclable
customer_reviews.text: I'm really torn on this cup. I like that it's reusable and recyclable. But I drop it constantly. I drop it in the toilet, I drop it on the floor at work. Then I'm stuck with my back up pads until I can boil it, which my boyfriend hates. Also it says to get every little crevice clean, but it has these tiny holes that I can't ever get the old blood out of. Also, sometimes it leaks and I'm not sure where I'm messing up when I put it in. It definitely take some zero waste dedication cause it's not very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Just try it!
customer_reviews.text: So I finally decided to buy it and try it. I was so sick of tampons with their horrible chemicals and the expense. First day I honestly was like “ what did I get myself into? I do not like this at all”. I had purchased the cup steamer and DivaWash so I had committed. First cycle is done and I like it so much that I won’t be going back to tampons or pads ever again. If you have been thinking about it just go for it! I honestly don’t have anything bad to say about it.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia Fernández

customer_reviews.title: Works but uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I liked there was no leaking, held it's structure after boiling and no over flowing. For me it was very uncomfortable. I think its to long. I got the model 1 because I'm 24 with 0 kids. I cut the stem 3 times and I still feel it scraping me right at the entrance. Im very active as I work out and a delivery driver for Amazon. I feel it doesn't stay secure as I'm moving a lot and feel scraping more and more and have to adjust to often. Idk if I should get a different model or cut it all the way to the cup. It does the job its just uncomfortable for me.
customer_reviews.author: shontay martin

customer_reviews.title: Painful
customer_reviews.text: I really love the idea of this but I hated the experience. It did a wonderful job keeping things clean and tidy which i loved, but it kept falling down and sideways and painfully poking into the side of my vagina. It hurt so bad. I was constantly in the bathroom trying to fix it. It also caused the worst cramping I’ve ever had in my life. Felt a lot like the contractions I got when I was giving birth. I emailed true company for help and they responded but my husband had already tossed the thing out because he was tired of seeing me miserable.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie White

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd brand of menstrual cup so I can only compare it to the other brand I used (Dutchess). The quality difference between the two brands is night and day. The Diva cup is a thicker cup and firmer cup. It’s easy to insert and remove. I did snip the tip end down as I had to with my Dutchess cups. I have been using it for 2 days so far on this cycle and no issues. No leaks. No difficulty inserting/removing. It’s comfortable. It’s. But pricy but far more cheaper here on amazon than in the stores.
customer_reviews.author: Fiercefoxie

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured out how to insert and take it out( there is a trick to it) it was a blessing from God! Our honeymoon was in Jamaica a few months after our wedding. Due to the stress of wedding and life, my period chose to show up on my honeymoon :( We had so many water activities scheduled and paid for with no real toilet accomidations available. This saved me!! I could leave it in for up to 12 hours!! Didnt have to worry about it. I had a slight bit of leaking the first day I was trying to figure it out but once I got it down..no problem! I am in love with this!
customer_reviews.author: Shawna C

customer_reviews.title: i ain't fraid of no flow!
customer_reviews.text: never thought i'd even try it but whoa this is changing the game. less nausea, less cramping, more sterile, less carbon footprint, more money saved. i marked so low on easy to remove because i'm still getting the hang of it, but this has changed the way i go through my cycle. i ain't scared of no flow! if you need help figuring out a perfect product for you, i went to putitinacup.com and read everything i could. truth be told: you will need to get really comfortable with your body during a really vulnerable time but why not!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Look, this takes some getting used to. I had slight discomfort when removing, but honestly I think it's just learning what method works best for me. No leaks, once I got in placed to my liking, i didn't notice that it was there. I used the standard size and i honestly cannot imagine using a larger one. yikes! But- I have not had children and I've had discomfort with nuva ring and menstrual discs in the past. Worth a try though ladies! for sure.
customer_reviews.author: CharD

customer_reviews.title: PCOS? Heavy flow? 12 hour shifts? No problem!
customer_reviews.text: There’s definitely a learning curve. I have polycystic ovarian syndrome (PCOS). I have a heavy flow, and I’m constantly leaking over pads. Tampons hurt so they’re a no go. I also work 12 hour shifts at a hospital, and can’t always get to the bathroom when I need to. It works great. I wear this and a pantyliner at work, just in case. Only had minor leaks at first when I was getting used to it. I’ve been even slept all night in it. I suggest watching some videos on YouTube. They definitely helped.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Hill

customer_reviews.title: 💯 YES you need this product
customer_reviews.text: I have used a diva cup for 7 years now. I absolutely love them and how much easier my periods have become and how much I actually don’t mind my period now. So comfortable. I will warn first time users it’s nothing like a tampon so inserting it is completely different. I looked on YouTube for hold suggestions and I recommend that. So once the initial learning process passes I highly recommend them. Not only are they better for our environment but so much better for our bodies. Holds so much more than a tampon and it’s so much more comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy the divacup!
customer_reviews.text: I was iffy at first about it, but oh my god this is the best purchase I've ever made. I never liked leaving tampons in too long so I would sleep with a pad but would always feel gross in the morning. I would also always have to worry about when it was time to change the tampon in the day. With the divacup I have never leaked, I can sleep comfortably without ever worrying, and once you get the hang of inserting it, its the absolute best. I can leave it in there for 12 hours and not ever think about it.
customer_reviews.author: Isis Borja

customer_reviews.title: Best Investment for People with Periods
customer_reviews.text: I bought the diva cup years ago and it’s a great investment for people who menstruate. I usually use it with a panty liner as a back up or I plan on getting some period panties soon. It can leak if you don’t have it in just right, but it takes getting a feel for it to know how to position it correctly for you. My periods aren’t too heavy, but on my heaviest day I can wear it for up to 12 hours and it holds everything. I highly recommend it! It’ll save you on buying tampons or pads and you’ll be decreasing your waste. A win for your wallet and the environment!
customer_reviews.author: Zoe Sand

customer_reviews.title: I did not feel it at all!
customer_reviews.text: It was very comfortable to wear and very easy to learn how to use. The first time would be a new experience but it was a positive one for me. I bought this because I didn’t want to keep paying money for period products like pads and figured that the quarantine would be the perfect time to try this since I didn’t have to go anywhere. I actually went on a bike ride and there was no spill and was basically like a tampon (I didn’t feel it at all) but is more secure (knowing that it definitely won’t spill).
customer_reviews.author: Katarina Nancy Gunawan

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: What was I doing before Divacup?! This has made my period so easy. It's like not having your period at all. So I will say, practice makes perfect. Comfort and ease truly depends on proper insertion. Be patient and try and try again. Eventually you'll get it dow. Took me 1 full cycle to really know what a proper "seal" feels like. You'll know right away when you got it right. Also, this is way more sanitary and affordable then tampons/pads. Total game changer. Ladies, give this a try!
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette

customer_reviews.title: Good but,
customer_reviews.text: Hard to get in but I managed. Box was destroyed luckily package was ok. Leaked after 6 hours due to already be full. Should have gotten a bigger size but didnt see the thing about childbirth.
customer_reviews.author: Keelan Kolek

customer_reviews.title: Finally found the one!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve given birth vaginally, twice. I’m very tight, but for some reason had a hard time with another brands cup which was too flimsy. This one is firm, opens easily when inserted, stays put and doesn’t leak. I made the mistake of trimming the stem before trying it out so I do have a tuff time removing, but that’s a small hiccup I’m willing to deal with. If you’ve had a hard time with other brands, bleed heavily or have had children, do yourself a favor and get this one! I promise you won’t be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Must have for any modern day woman.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my Diva Cup. This was my second one. It does take a little time to get used to. The first 3 months I had issues with leaking but once you get the hang of inserting it then it’s smooth sailing. It may seem a little expensive but I had my first diva cup for 4 years. Had I bought tampons that whole time I would have spent hundreds! It saves money and helps the environment. Personally it helped with my cramps as well.
customer_reviews.author: Elisha

customer_reviews.title: Try it! I did and am happy with it!
customer_reviews.text: Alright ladies I took the plunge and finally tried the cup! It is very comfortable and not difficult to use at all. The packaging and directions were great and informative. I loved how long I could wear this. I wouldn’t feel comfortable usiing this without a private sink. Idk how I would do using it in a public bathroom with stalls. You have to be comfortable with your body to get it in and out but I know practice will help!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I Love!
customer_reviews.text: I love Diva Cup, and I recommend it to anyone who will listen to me. Its a great way to be a little more environmentally friendly, and make your life 10x easier while doing it. I know the outright expense might feel steep but when you consider how much you spend on tampons/pads/disposable cups month after month, the price becomes a lot more doable. And I love it because its a super easy 12 hr wear. Theres a bit of a learning curve but it took me maybe three tries before I figured it out. Also have NEVER had a single leak, and I've ridden a bike wearing this thing. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Zillah Elcin

customer_reviews.title: No more cramps. Saving money (and the planet)
customer_reviews.text: Fit me well. Learning how to put it in was sometimes a challenge, so be patient with it. I save a lot of money using this instead of tampons or pads. It's nice to only have to switch it twice a day. I also have significantly less cramps wearing this. For those more environmentally conscious, there is also significantly less waste because you're not throwing anything in the garbage. I don't use the diva wash, but I do rinse very well and boil it after every cycle. It's holding up well, and not a lot of discoloration. Not that you must be comfortable touching yourself, and if you're squeamish with blood, this is probably not the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kira Boyle

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second diva cup the only reason I got rid of my first one was because I decided to have another baby and I wasn't sure how long it was going to be before my next cycle. I love that they are long lasting and easy to clean for me tampons are so drying and pads are so smelly the diva cup is really the only reasonable option and I love it. it can be a little difficult at first if you've never had one before just to get the feel for it might take you a few cycles before you can get insertion right with ease. But once you have it that's the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea H.

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: *first time user* I LOVE this thing! If you’re squeamish about touching yourself or blood this is probably not the product for you. Once I got the hang of inserting and removing it, the rest is a piece of cake! My flow was too heavy for tampons (they would just flow right out) and pads were always soooooooo messy. And I liked the idea of reducing the amount of waste I create. I was worried my flow would be too much, but the 2 is perfect! I’ve had no leaks, it feels just like a tampon, and I can go the full 12 hours without changing it!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: YESSSSS
customer_reviews.text: This is what I have been missing my whole life! Seriously, try it. I was skeptic and a little nervous about it myself but I'm on day three of using it and it's changed my life. I will never buy another pad or tampon. Not only is it saving me money but it's making my life so much easier. No more emergency runs to the store, no more trash cans full of gross, no more carrying pads around in my handbag. It's great.
customer_reviews.author: Kayleejo90

customer_reviews.title: A bit long but it works
customer_reviews.text: Before buying this I've used the soft cups. The DivaCup holds a lot more. I had to cut off the stem completely because the cup is a bit long. Some even suggest turning it inside out, which works as well and makes the cup shorter. As with the soft cups, I use a small pad on day 1 in case of any leaks. No issues getting it in our out, and it's not messy to empty it during the day. All in all I am pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: Works well and better for your body
customer_reviews.text: I had issues with endometriosis. After watching a doctor discuss how unnatural things like tampons can contribute to endometriosis, I bought this for my 17 year old. It does take getting used to and practice with placement to ensure no leaks. My daughter likes the comfort by the ease of only needing to change it twice a day. She can even forget she is on her period at all. .
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to like it
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been keeping my eye on one of these menestral cups for a while now and after reading what seemed like a good amount of good reviews I decided to go for it. I really wanted to like it, but it was a nightmare from the start. It hurt going in. It hurt coming out. It leaked, and it was a bloody nightmare (literally). I tried and tired and then tried some more. Reading and Then rereading the instructions. Really bummed but it was a terrible experience for me !
customer_reviews.author: Shakirian Bonebrake

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: I have several friends who swear by these cups and I had high hopes, but it wasn't for me. Had trouble inserting it, even when doing the folding of the cup like they recommend. It also caused a lot of pain and could never get it inserted right and finally just gave up.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin W.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: The Diva Cup is comfortable especially for beginners. It has definitely saved me money on menstrual pads. I prefer this over any other method because it actually reduces my cramps. If you are a beginner, it is completely normal to feel a little discomfort at first and even the second month around but it will get extremely better, I promise! For women who have a heavier flow, I suggest changing the cup more frequently then 12 hours maybe like 3-6 hours. However, I have a heavier flow and this works beautifully for me!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: True review
customer_reviews.text: Likes: 0 waste/ great for the environment No chemicals enter the body Great eval of the quality of menses Comfy to wear Complete removal of menses Dislikes: does not hold up to heavy period days, change every 10 min is a far cry from all day wear. A bit cumbersome to remove/clean/ reinsert every 10min Always requires a single bathroom with sink- which isnt always available
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Looking forward to my pool party next weekend
customer_reviews.text: Revolutionary!! I am 33 with 2 kids, got the model 2. I first placed it while in the shower with no problem and removed it about 2 hours later, just to see if it was working and if I would have any trouble taking it out. No leaks and no problem taking it out!!! I twist and gently pull down until it is out. I have not hit my heavy days yet so I will update at the end of my cycle, but I've had it for about 6 hours and am in love!
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Wearing this is like I don’t even have my period
customer_reviews.text: For years I hated on these until I really wanted to reduce waste and my carbon footprint. Now I’m hooked! No fuss no mess, and I can’t feel it! It’s almost as if I don’t have my period 😁 and if your worried about having to dump these out, I do it once a day. U would be surprised at how much blood you actually secrete.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: Using this has been life changing. I no longer use tampons because I don’t like the waste of cotton With throw away menstrual options or the chemicals inside them. This is a little difficult to get used to but WORTH IT! Folding it for use and application was my biggest issue because once I get it in, you have to insert it further to stay and actually catch the blood. I no longer use anything else for that time of month. Just boil to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Gillian

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Healthier than tampons and good for the environment!
customer_reviews.text: This product has helped me cope with my sensitivity to tampons and desire to cut down on monthly feminine products. It’s easy to clean in your daily shower and with a little practice, simple to insert comfortably. The measuring guide on the side has also helped me keep track of my heavier than normal period flow and allowed me the proof I needed to get adequate medical treatment. For personal health and the good of the environment, I think every woman should have one of these at their disposal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT! Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you buy the correct model. I think Model 2 is mostly for mothers who have given birth, as it is slightly larger in size. Model 1 is best for me. I love this product and have been using it for 10 years. I bought another brand once and was very disappointed and immediately went back to this brand. It works great! Good for the environment and MUCH cleaner than pads/tampons.
customer_reviews.author: Professor

customer_reviews.title: Good but buy the right size/brand for your body, look into all the brands/sizes before buying
customer_reviews.text: I think this size is a bit too big for me (I based it on the fact that I'm nearly 30, but should have considered that I'm very petite and have never had children) so I will probably buy a different brand/size that is more recommended for me. But it was still good to wear and works AMAZINGLY. It's definitely a big change to switch to these, and I am a fan. Pretty difficult to learn how to use, but I'd say worth it in the end. I'd suggest looking into the right fit for you (ask your dr about how your cervix sits, that's apparently important?) and not just buying the most popular brand and hoping it works out.
customer_reviews.author: B. Pen

customer_reviews.title: Life changing
customer_reviews.text: I’ve heard of a menstrual cup before but never cared to check it out until one day I was just tired of tampons and pads. So I decided to do a little research about them and give it a go. Let me just say.... my life has changed ever since I bought this back in October 2019. I love this thing so much!! I have saved a lot of money from buying stupid expensive tampons/pads. But I will say, it might be a little difficult at first but once you get it down, it’s perfectly fine! Occasionally it might leak, but it’s not often and to only change it roughly every 12 hours is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: With these types of products you don't know if you'll like it until you use it and unfortunately you can't ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to throw this away and it really bummed me out. With these types of products you don't know if you'll like it until you use it and unfortunately you can't return it once it has been used. I'm 32 years old and haven't had children. This size was way too big and uncomfortable. It never suctioned correctly because it was never able to expand and open once placed inside. I like the idea, but it just did not work for me. Since they're not inexpensive I don't want to risk trying the smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia Wright

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: This is the second diva cup that I've purchased. The first one I had I use for a full year before I became pregnant. So easy to use. So much more comfortable than tampons. Never had any issues with leaking even though I would wear a panty liner just in case. I'm now on size 2 due to having a child. These last so much longer than tampons and are so much easier to use. So if you're considering switching I highly recommend it. Wish I was introduced to this earlier in life.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Smith

customer_reviews.title: Just say yes.
customer_reviews.text: I had never tried a menstrual cup before and finally tried this. Game changer. There's definitely a learning curve, but it's so worth it!!! If you figure it out, you won't regret it. Also, since using the cup, I've had to use tampons like twice when I was caught unprepared. I got horrible cramps both times with tampons, but my cramps have really subsided since using the Diva cup! Try it--that's half invitation, half demand. This will change your life.
customer_reviews.author: ES

customer_reviews.title: Can’t believe I just discovered these
customer_reviews.text: I heard about these on a podcast and bought one to use after I had my daughter. I forgot about it until quarantine, which was a great time to learn! There’s a learning curve but man I’ll never go back to pads and tampons! I still wear a light pad sometimes for extra overnight, but I hope to teach my daughter about these when she gets older! It’s a win all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for about a year. It’s a life changer. I wish I started using it earlier. Not having to worry about my periods outside the house is amazing. No changing tampons in public restroom, no smell that sometimes come with pads... A couple of times, I had terrible cramps not long after inserting it. Like reaaaaally bad. I didn’t realize right away it was because of the cup. Once I realized that it was because I inserted it funky it was very easy, removed it, reinserted it and the pain was gone. Be careful to not insert it too high, if it feels uncomfortable or painful try to lower it.
customer_reviews.author: popothamm

customer_reviews.title: Learning curve, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product. I’ve always been a tampon user but have a very heavy period. Like learning to use any new product, there is a little bit of a learning curve and putting it in and taking it out the first few times is very awkward. I trimmed the stem after the first used because I could feel it slightly. But I had far less dryness, cramping and pain using this than a tampon. I could leave it in for about 4 hours with a heavy heavy flow (super tampon change every 2 hours) and didn’t leak. I’m a convert.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie B.

customer_reviews.title: JUST TRY IT ALREADY!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I was skeptical at first...but I love this thing!! Tampons are soooo toxic for your body! So I feel like I’m doing something better for my body, and the ENVIRONMENT by using this (there are billions of women on this planet...where do we think all these “products” are going...gross!) Be good to your body, and the planet :) I never have leaks, never have to worry about how many hours it’s been or TSS, and I save money on tampons! Score
customer_reviews.author: NEsposito

customer_reviews.title: works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Well, ill be damned if this hasnt changed my life in 1 cycle! Saving money AND the environment while also gaining back some of my freedom. Its nice to wake up dry. Is it messy? YES. Is it a bit tricky? Absolutely. Is it worth it? HELL YES IT IS! Got it down in 3 days. I got the #1. Im 41, no children, thought it was a gamble on size, tho this size is ok, Ill purchase the #2 fit just for those heavier cycles. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Ellison J

customer_reviews.title: Yay!
customer_reviews.text: After watching YouTube reviews on this i felt like I should try it. Pros: 12 hours - hey-ya! Environmentally friendly Financial savings Comfortable No leaks! Cons: It’s a cup full of blood I mean it’s not pretty but either were used tampons. I read the reviews on here for tips to insert and remove and I had no issues. I don’t feel it, no leaks, no more nasty chemicals from tampons, no more buying tampons. I’m an official convert. Wish I’d done it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: ChristineLeigh

customer_reviews.title: I totally recommend it!!
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical to buy this because I was scared it wasn't going to work or it was going to be very comfortable. I love it!! It's great cause you don't have to spend money or be concerned if you have enough Tampons or pads for the days of your period. I totally recommend it. But you must know you have to be comfortable with your body.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Castellanos

customer_reviews.title: Revolutionary!
customer_reviews.text: I will likely never go back to tampons again, I love this product and I love that it produces no waste. It comes with a discreet carrying pouch which I love! Menstrual cups do take some getting used to, especially when removing the product but once you get over that hurdle I found these to be so hassle-free. I also can get through a whole day of work without changing it, and it doesn't dry you out. They are easy to clean, easier to travel with compared to tampons/pads, plus they kind of force you to educate yourself about your own anatomy. Which is always a benefit. Knowledge is power.
customer_reviews.author: Tiarra

customer_reviews.title: Better than tampons
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little patience to get positioning right. Rotating the cup once it's in is crucial to making sure it unfolds properly. Removal can be messy, but I just take a shower every time I'm cleaning it and that works well. There's no need to change it more than twice a day unless your flow is SUPER heavy. Due to endocrine issues, I get two periods a month. I've been using this cup for about 5 months and don't need to replace it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Z

customer_reviews.title: Not good suction
customer_reviews.text: This cup was great before I sterilize it (and yes I used it before sterilizing it because I didn't have ability to do it, but when I was able too, well that's when I start experiencing the problem with the cup). When I boiled for couple of min the cup, then the suction lost its power and it doesnt stay inside anymore. It just slowly slides out and I get blood everywhere...
customer_reviews.author: Jewel

customer_reviews.title: Threw away after 30 seconds ss
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a size 2 since I've had 2 kids. Have used other brands with no issues. This one caused me pain and discomfort right away. Of course cant return it but it was an expensive 30 seconds of pain. Threw it in the trash and went back to my cheaper brand cup.
customer_reviews.author: Ally K.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work for everyone but the concept is nice.
customer_reviews.text: The concept is great but after 2 kids my body is no longer built to hold this product. I even asked my OBGYN why it wouldn’t stay in place and she confirmed it was because of the way my body ended up after childbirth. I’m not the only one that has had this issue (I know 2 others with the same problem) so know that it does not work for everyone...especially those that have had kids and ended up with a different anatomy, post-baby.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: First time menstrual cup user
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I wish I started using this sooner. I'll never go back to disposable products. It is NOT as intimidating to take in and out as you'd think. It worked for me the first try. It stays in easily for hours on end. This is a great option if you have a high cervix! Really impressed - make the switch, it's not as scary as you think!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Travis

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Was a little skeptical at first to use one but after about 6 months of use I will never go back. Easy to use and the comfort level is insane. It almost feels like you’re not wearing anything at all. It’s not as messy as you may think and it’s easy to clean and maintain. I also like that I am no longer spending an arm and a leg on tampons and pads that are also harmful to the environment
customer_reviews.author: Riley M

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer!
customer_reviews.text: I have heavy flows. Like incredibly heavy. I’m use to changing tampons 2x within an hour and still leaning on a pad. And nightime? I slept with a towel. Using the cup is a game changer. The first night I woke up to a clean bed I was sold! I emptied the cup and it was nearly full! And no leaks. I’ve also observed that my periods- although still heavy are much shorter now. I really think using ‘plugs’ held back the natural flow & extended my cycle
customer_reviews.author: SLG

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST THING SINCE SLICED BREAD
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this brand for about 3-4 years now. Though I haven't used any other brand, I can say it is way better than using the normal tampons or pads. I love my diva cup and will never go back to using anything else. The diva cup gives me confidence that my period is handled correctly. I do tend to have heavy periods but the diva cup holds up really well. It comforts me to know that I'm also doing my body justice by using a very safe silicon menstrual cup. I recommend 100% to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel H

customer_reviews.title: Aaaaamazing product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Looooove this product! Not sure how I’ve gone so long without it! Highly recommend it to everyone. It’s suler comfortable! So much, that I forget I even have it in. Never have any leaks, as long as I have it in correctly. It’s a little bit of a learning curve, but once you catch the hang of it, you’re a pro. Look up some tutorials on YouTube for tips. I can’t believe I went 17 years without this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: DivaCup - Menstrual Cup - Feminine Hygiene - Leak-Free - BPA Free - Model 1
product_meta.description: Size:Model 1The DivaCup is an eco-friendly, cost-effective, durable and chemical-free vaginal cup that will save you both money and time. By switching to the DivaCup, you will no longer produce 300 pounds of waste, which is about how much an average person creates in a lifetime using disposable feminine hygiene products. This also means no more spending tons of money on pads and panty liners, since these menstrual cups last up to a year. The DivaCup is soft and made from durable silicone that becomes more flexible with body heat. This menstrual cup is made with women's health in mind, so say goodbye to feminine pads and tampons. It features leak-resistant air holes under the rim to create a seal that secures the cup in place. It is simple to grip for easy removal. Once the cup becomes too old to use, the DivaCup is recyclable where facilities exist. We have also implemented our own program with the use of a very sophisticated holographic sticker so you can authenticate your cup online.
feature_bullets: Reusable Period Cup: Say goodbye to tampons and pads with comfortable, eco-friendly protection
Silicone Menstrual Cup: Made of 100% medical grade silicone with no chemicals, plastic or dyes
Recognition: The DivaCup is recognized by the Society for Obstetricians and Gynecologists of Canada
Certified B Corp: Our company meets the highest standards of social and environmental performance
Made For You: Ideal for anyone between the ages of 19 and 34, who haven't given birth vaginally
